channel.title: Data Analysis on Graham Tierney
channel.description: Recent content in Data Analysis on Graham Tierney

item.title: What About the Emails?
item.description: The Project One fateful day while I was bored during a lecture, I decided to sign up for email messages from each Senate campaign during the 2018 election cycle.1 A lot of people study the impact of political advertisements on various outcomes, and I thought some interesting trends might emerge in the email blasts that campaigns send out. The Data I signed up using a new email address, and only filled out the required fields to get on mailing lists.

item.title: The Genetics of Magic
item.description: Introduction Last spring, I took a class on Bayesian statistics at the University of Chicago that had several exercises focused on building a model to classify species based on their genome. The basic setup was that you were given a data set of salmon, their genome sequencing data, and which sub-population they belonged to. From this data, we needed to build a model to classify new salmon into the sub-populations.
